Client Services Manager

Company Name Verticurl (a WPP Company) Company Location Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 1 hour ago Number of views 2 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

If you're reading this job posting, then chances are you're looking to make a career change because you're not challenged, not empowered to drive success, or not appreciated in your current position. \xa0Sound familiar? \xa0Keep reading. \xa0Verticurl is currently evaluating candidates for a Client Services Manager to be an important member of our team. Top-notch professionals from around the world are joining the Verticurl team for:

\xa0

  • Opportunities to join a fast growing global organization and accept a new career challenge
  • Flexibility to show off demand generation muscle and sharpen your skills \xa0
  • Recognition and appreciation for hard work, smart thinking, and expertise

\xa0

This position is a unique opportunity for a Verticurl team member to serve as a trusted advisor to our existing customers by ensuring they achieve success with demand generation technologies. By leveraging a consultative approach, this resource would work closely with their customers to understand their business objectives, determine the best approach for leveraging Verticurl’s capabilities, and provide recommendations on best practices.

This position requires a minimum of 3 years marketing experience in demand generation and marketing automation.


Client Services

  • Drive and manage client relationships. Develop success plans for customers that outline their critical success factors, metrics for success, potential issues and provide recommendations
  • Collect requirements and requests from clients for new projects, manage client expectations externally while overseeing the delivery team internally to ensure quality standards and client satisfaction are met
  • Closely monitor adoption rates of assigned accounts; provide keen insight into exactly how customers are using our service, the pros and cons, and identification of areas for improvement
  • Act as liaison between the delivery team and the customer to serve as a subject matter expert on marketing automation and CRM technologies
  • Prepare weekly status reports and conduct weekly update meetings with clients
  • Advise clients on industry best practice in marketing automation and demand generation

\xa0

Project Management

  • Prepare project plans, monitor task completion, track deadlines and milestones
  • Create and executes project work plans and revise as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirements.
  • Identify resources needed and assign individual responsibilities.
  • Manage day-to-day operational aspects of a project and scope.
  • Effectively apply our methodology and enforce project standards.
  • Prepare for engagement reviews and follow quality assurance procedures
  • Minimize our exposure and risk on project.
  • Ensure project documents are complete, current, and stored appropriately.

\xa0

Marketing Automation Support

  • Serve as a marketing automation resource for clients to facilitate client requests for minor updates or changes to campaigns
  • Periodically generate reports from CRM or marketing automation technologies, analyze results, and provide recommendations to clients for improvement
  • Create, design and coordinate implementation of demand generation programs in Marketing Automation Platform(s)

\xa0

\xa0

Skills & Qualifications:

  • Possess experience in Database Marketing, Marketing Operations, or Email Marketing; Experience in an agency role is a plus
  • Exceptional Communication skills.
  • Minimum 7 years experience in business-to-business demand generation
  • Experience in management of P&L
  • Strong process development skills; ability to transform best practices and prospect requirements into highly efficient and executable business processes.
  • Ability to apply creative thinking and sound reasoning, and to communicate effectively verbally and in writing.
  • Strong interpersonal skills. Must be able to work independently and function as a strong team player.
  • Proactive, meticulous, detail-oriented and capable of handling a high volume of work
  • Must be able to demonstrate resourcefulness, motivation, initiative.
  • Results oriented, outstanding attention to detail, ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.
  • Excellent analysis skills and the ability to develop processes and methodologies
  • Experience in marketing automation
  • Positive attitude and desire to grow within an emerging organization

883721951:
[

Communications Manager

Company Name Cotton Australia Company Location Mascot, New South Wales, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 191 views

Job description

Are you a communications specialist who can think strategically, proactively manage issues and also roll-up your sleeves to implement a plan?\xa0 Are you keen to work with a small team of dedicated staff who are passionate about agriculture and regional affairs?


Cotton Australia is a dynamic peak industry group representing the interests of Australia's cotton farmers.\xa0 It advocates in the best interests of growers and the industry to all levels of government, stakeholders and the wider community.


The Australian cotton industry is a leader in Australia’s agriculture sector and in global sustainability practices. It’s an industry that’s open and transparent, innovative and collaborative. And it’s an industry that requires strong communication and engagement with a wide range of stakeholders including farmers, regional communities, media and influencers.


Cotton Australia is seeking a Communications Manager to join the team, based in its Sydney office. Reporting to the CEO, you will help drive and deliver Cotton Australia’s communication strategy.

\xa0

The successful applicant will have:

  • Strategic communication thinking and planning skills
  • Practical experience in pro-actively managing critical issues and the ability to provide outstanding strategic advice to Senior Management and Board
  • Excellent practical communication and writing skills across a broad spectrum of communication platforms
  • Knowledge of and commitment to Australian agriculture and rural affairs, as well as a working knowledge of politics;
  • An ability to network within media and industry spheres; ideally you will have an existing network in place;
  • Skills in social media, digital strategy and website management;
  • Relevant tertiary qualifications, and at least five years’ experience in senior communication positions; and
  • An ability to work well with a small and cohesive team

\xa0

Key duties of the role include:

  • Developing and implementing the organisation’s strategic communication plan;
  • Producing a wide range of traditional and social media product and communication tools and distributing these through appropriate channels;
  • Ensuring the cotton industry is fairly and appropriately represented by the media;
  • Working with Cotton Australia staff to synthesise complex issues into simple messages, and to ensure staff are properly-equipped to deal with media issues;
  • Working to tight time frames to manage various projects and commitments.

\xa0

\xa0

Some regional and interstate travel will be required.

Salary (within a range of $100,000 - $150,000) will be negotiated based on experience.

\xa0

Further information:

Michael Murray, General Manager, Cotton Australia: 0427 707868

www.cottonaustralia.com.au

Applications and requests for Position Description should be e-mailed to jobs@cotton.org.au

Job description

The Department of Economic Development, Jobs, Transport and Resources (DEDJTR) is the Victorian Government’s lead agency for creating the conditions to sustainably develop the Victorian economy and grow employment. Our role is to increase jobs, investment, exports and opportunities; stimulate innovation, competitiveness, and confidence; and support sustainability.

The Department is committed to building a culture where we say 'yes' to flexible work arrangements, and support ways of working that help employees balance work and home life. The Department is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applicants from a diverse range of backgrounds.

The Department strongly encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

The Department offers reasonable adjustments for applicants with disabilities on request.

MANAGER COMMUNITY AND STAKEHOLDER ENGAGEMENT

  • $116,863 - $156,387 (Plus Superannuation)
  • Fixed Term – 12 months
  • Usual hours of work: Full Time (flexibility may be available)
  • Usual work location: Melbourne CBD (flexibility may be available)

The position of Manager Community and Stakeholder Engagement forms a part of the Resources division, Earth Resources Policy and Programs branch within the Employment, Investment and Trade group.

Reporting to the Acting Director Minerals Development Victoria, you will be responsible for the design and delivery of a range of community and stakeholder engagement activities associated with a number of high profile earth resources projects and initiatives.

To be successful in this role, you will have comprehensive knowledge of and experience in government policy development and engagement programs with a demonstrated ability to develop and manage staff, teams and resources. Proven experience in implementing contemporary community and stakeholder engagement practices along with the ability to identify and implement positive change, including innovative thinking. A relevant tertiary degree would be well regarded.

For a confidential discussion, please call Helen Foard on 03 9452 8969.

Successful candidates will be required to undergo a National Police Records Check prior to commencing employment with the Department.

884534790:
[

Senior Commercial Performance Analyst

Company Name Qantas Company Location Sydney

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 173 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Senior Commercial Performance Analyst

  • Permanent opportunity, Mascot location
  • Challenge yourself in adding significant value to Qantas’ Domestic Revenue Performance team
  • At Qantas, our teams come together to create new and unique customer experiences

At Qantas, we represent Australia to the world. Our diverse country is known for its unique spirit, mateship, and a can-do attitude. Together we’re strong and resilient, and we work hard to make sure we’re always at our best.

While we operate in an unpredictable industry, we thrive on uncertainty and are always ready for a challenge. We take a commercial mindset to all that we do, ensuring we make strategic decisions that live up to our customer’s expectations.

As Senior Commercial Performance Analyst you will help assure Qantas Domestic business performance with a financial, programmatic and strategic lens. You will help shape key aspects of business strategy, support forecasting, risk management and performance delivery, as well as evolve efforts to identify and drive continued revenue improvements across both the international and domestic segments of Qantas Airlines. You will collaborate across all business areas relevant to domestic planning and revenue performance – including Revenue Management, Sales, Digital Direct, Network Planning, QantasLink, Customer Experience, Loyalty and Group Finance.

Reporting into the Head of Domestic Revenue Performance, this role will see you support planning and driver-based performance forecasting for the Qantas Domestic business, helping ensure proactive and early identification of performance opportunities and risks, conduct reviews of business investment cases as well as providing constructive challenge to business areas and develop action plans with relevant functional and business teams. You will support content preparation for Qantas Domestic Management Boards, Business Unit Reviews, monthly Qantas Airlines (QALT) and QAD (QDLT) Leadership Team meetings, CFO Leadership Team meetings and Qantas Board discussions.

You will support overall business performance analysis, insights and reporting, including process evolution that ensures a high level of transparency for revenue performance and its drivers. You will coordinate across business areas mentioned above and the Qantas International performance team to help identify, prioritise and ensure pursuit of the most significant revenue performance and transformation opportunities.

To succeed in this role, you will be curious, courageous and collaborative. You will also demonstrate a high level of strategic, commercial and financial acumen, as well as strong skills in excel-based analytics and power point presentation design.

Qantas is an equal opportunity employer, so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of an organisation that encourages diversity, supports charities and environmental initiatives. We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, and people of all backgrounds to apply. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application.

Be a part of something special and play your part in the Qantas story – get in touch today.

Applications close Tuesday 2nd October 2018

884201687:
[

Organisational Development Specialist

Company Name nib health funds Company Location Sydney

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 73 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

There has never been a more exciting time to join the nib People and Culture team! There are big things happening at nib. Not only do we exist to provide our customers with affordable health care when and where needed, we continue to challenge the status quo and look for new and innovative ways to grow our business.


To support nib’s strategic agenda, our key people strategy is to have the right people, establish nib as the place to work with the best of the best, actively develop a high organisational culture and engage our people. We are now looking an experienced Organisational Development Specialist to join our People and Culture team in Sydney CBD.


Having a diverse and inclusive workforce that is representative of the community we serve is a pivotal element of nib’s business strategy. Consistent with nib’s value that we will always respect that people that matter most, you will be instrumental in partnering with Group Executives and key stakeholders to execute diversity and inclusion strategies and Organisation Design across the nib Group.


What you will do


This role will see you play a key role in scoping, developing and delivering support to our business groups.\xa0


As an experienced OD professional, you will work as part of a collaborative team to design and deliver strategies and solutions that enhance the overall organisational capability, culture and employee engagement. You will have the opportunity to contribute to a number of current OD & organisational change priorities across the areas of Diversity & Inclusion and Organisational Design. You will partner with the business and your peers to identify OD needs based on strategic imperatives and organisational diagnostics.\xa0


The OD strategies and solutions that you develop will be evidence-based, aligned to the organisational strategy and operating model and contribute to enhanced levels of employee engagement and performance. \xa0\xa0You will act as a trusted adviser and senior leader to the business and your peers to provide insights and advice that enhance the ability of our business to deliver on the People and Culture vision and strategy.


About you


Due to the nature of our agile business, we are looking for someone to hit the ground running. Your extensive experience in a similar OD role within an innovative, fast paced organisation coupled with a relevant tertiary qualification in Organisational Psychology (or similar), to back up your hands on experience. You will have demonstrated experience in designing, developing and delivering OD solutions including: talent development, job design and workforce planning, reward and recognition, leadership and management development, succession planning, and employee engagement.


If you have a desire to make a real contribution and work with a team of talented professionals to support the growth of our people and our business, then this might be the next step in your career.


Why it’s worth it


This is a great opportunity to work with a driven and successful People and Culture team and play a key part in achieving nib’s business strategy. nib offers great employee benefits including discounted health insurance, an employee incentive scheme, and discounted gym memberships plus more. Nothing beats working in a friendly, interactive and challenging work environment that supports your career development! We will give you the support you need to help balance your career with the things that make your life rich – such as family, health and doing the things you love.

About St. Vincent's Hospital

St Vincent's Hospital Melbourne (SVHM) is part of St Vincent's Health Australia and a leading teaching, research and tertiary health service which employs more than 5,000 staff across 18 sites throughout Melbourne. SVHM provides a diverse range of adult clinical services including acute medical and surgical services, sub-acute care, medical diagnostics, rehabilitation, allied health, mental health, palliative care, correctional health and community residential care. SVHM is one of Australia's leading Catholic not-for-profit healthcare providers.

About The Department

St Vincent's Pathology is a private practice offering diagnostic testing to both inpatients of St Vincent's private Hospitals located in Fitzroy, East Melbourne and Kew, St Vincent's Public Hospital Fitzroy as well as servicing privately referred patients in up to 80 Pathology Collection centres located across Melbourne. St Vincent's Pathology enjoys a high reputation for quality and service in the provision of comprehensive diagnostic pathology testing.

Consultant Anaesthetist

Dept of Anaesthesia

Casual Locum Positions available

Ballarat Health Services are currently accepting Expressions of Interest for a locum within the Anaesthetic department.
Ballarat Health Services comprises the Base Hospital (221 acute beds), Queen Elizabeth Centre (Sub Acute Care 70 beds) and Psychiatric Services (67 beds]. New short stay unit and modern, emergency, critical care, ambulatory, aged care and rehabilitation facilities uniquely integrate in-patient, ambulatory, community and home based services. Ballarat Health Services is a major training site for the University of Melbourne and Deakin Rural Clinical Schools. Senior staff are strongly committed to teaching and the professional development of Interns, HMOs and Registrars.

Ballarat Health Services is an expanding and well regarded multi-service regional health organisation, and a major service provider for the Grampians region (pop: 200,000+) with over 24,000 annual admissions.

Ballarat offers a superb regional lifestyle with excellent public and private schools, recreational and sporting facilities, shopping, entertainment and cultural pursuits. Country or city living is available within minutes of the hospital and there is easy access to Melbourne (80 minutes).

Anaesthetics – why Ballarat?
  • Join a team of 30 Consultant anaesthetists and intensivists, 8 anaesthetic registrars and 3 HMO's.

About Us

At Uniting, we believe in taking real steps to make the world a better place. We work to inspire people, enliven communities and confront injustice.

Our services are in the areas of aged care and disability, community services, and chaplaincy and we get involved in social justice and advocacy issues that impact the people we serve. We commit to respecting children and take action to keep them safe.

As an organisation we celebrate our diversity and welcome all people regardless of lifestyle choices, ethnicity, faith, sexual orientation and gender identity.

About The Opportunity

Uniting’s commitment to Australia’s First Peoples is lead by the Aboriginal Service Development Unit(ASDU) who advocate and provide voice for the inclusive relationships with Aboriginal people and communities across NSW/ACT. The Unit works with all staff, leaders, management and mission across the organisation to assure strong cultural conscience, practice and services are provided by Uniting.

We’re looking for a Project Officer to support the ASDU so we can continue to promote a unified and inclusive Aboriginal voice across the organisation. 885556179:
[

Forensic Residential Worker - SE Melb / Bayside

Company Name ACSO Australia Company Location Armadale, AU

New Posted Date Posted 12 hours ago

Be an early applicant

Job description

Are you looking for a meaningful new role?

Do you have a strong belief in humanity and the basic right to a second chance?

Want to work for a really interesting and focused Not for Profit (NFP) organization?

If you answered 'yes' to those questions, then read on! We are looking for residential support staff for our clients to function safely in the community.

A Little About ACSO

The Australian Community Support Organisation (ACSO) is a dynamic, values driven NFP, focused on partnering with Government and the community to co-design services that create real social change. We’re an organisation with a bold vision to create a safe and inclusive community freed of crime and prisons. It’s our goal to reduce re-offending and our mission is to help people transition from prison, assist them in the community, stop them from re-offending, and intervene to divert others from committing crime.

About The Program

ACSO’s Forensic Residential Support (FRS) program provides treatment and lifestyle support to clients with a forensic history background and a disability. Success requires staff to strike the balance between risks and rights. Read more about the program here

About The Role

You’ll work directly with adults who have an intellectual or cognitive disability and an offending history. This will involve intake and client assessments, care plan meetings, individual support and treatment planning, and preparation for client transitions out of ACSO’s residential house.

This is a full time position working a 24/7 rotating roster. Day-to-day you will support clients with life skills and practical tasks combined with contributing to the development and implementation of Behaviour Support Plans and other therapeutic intervention strategies.

In the medium to long term you will work with a team to facilitate activities to support clients’ reengagement with the community.

You will both contribute to and be offered practical and expert advice from a multi-disciplinary, clinically focused team, with a strong supervision structure to support you in your role and in your continued professional development.

What You’ll Have

A passion for community safety, the right to a second chance, interested in developing and contributing to therapeutic support and intervention, and a drive to make a difference!
  • Depth of knowledge of the challenges faced by those leaving the prison system, and an interest and willingness to work with those presenting with high risk offence histories with complex and challenging behaviour
  • Passion for supporting people with disability related challenges to achieve their goals
  • Knowledge & experience utilising prosocial approaches in managing offending behaviours
  • Prior experience working in residential care settings
  • Capability to establish and maintain clear professional boundaries
  • Strong sense of personal accountability, resilience and emotional intelligence
  • Drivers Licence, First Aid, and the ability to obtain National Criminal Record, Working With Children, and Disability Worker Exclusion Scheme checks.

We’re offering
  • 2 x Part time & Casual (2 shifts per week)
  • $63,373 base salary (1FTE) + allowances and penalties + super + generous NFP sal pac options
  • 17.5% annual leave loading
  • South East Metro / Bayside location
  • 8km from CBD, free street parking, accessed by 1 train and 3 tram lines
  • Great learning opportunities

To apply please visit our careers website www.acso.org.au/work-with-us/ and provide your resume and a brief cover letter (please outline your claims against the selection criteria listed in the PD).

Applications close: 9am Monday 8 Oct '18

We’ll be reviewing applications as they’re received so don’t delay, apply now!

ACSO embraces diversity within its workforce and as such encourages applications from appropriately qualified and skilled people from a range of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, including those from Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Island heritage.

Job description

About Uber

We’re changing the way people think about transportation. Not that long ago we were just an app to request premium black cars in a few metropolitan areas. Now we’re a part of the logistical fabric of more than 600 cities around the world. Whether it’s a ride, a sandwich, or a package, we use technology to give people what they want, when they want it.

For the people who drive with Uber, our app represents a flexible new way to earn money. For cities, we help strengthen local economies, improve access to transportation, and make streets safer.

And that’s just what we’re doing today. We’re thinking about the future, too. With teams working on autonomous trucking and self-driving cars, we’re in for the long haul. We’re reimagining how people and things move from one place to the next.

Who You Are

We are looking to build a team of rock stars for our Greenlight locations across Australia and New Zealand. We need people with strong communication and problem-solving skills, who don’t shy away from in-person interactions. Aside from helping customers, our support centre is also used to educate and teach our customers - driver and delivery partners - how to best use our app. You’ll be expected to help upload documents, provide exceptional support, and quickly adapt in an ever-growing business. This is a great opportunity to work with a top-notch Operations team and deep dive into our day-to-day-operations. This is a casual role with the potential for extension.

What You’ll Do
  • Deliver 5-star, on-brand, in-person support for our driver and delivery partners
  • Assist partners through the onboarding process and give them all the tools they need to be successful with Uber and walk driver and delivery partners through our app and how to use all the tools to use our app in the most efficient way possible

  • Stay on top of new Uber policies, procedures, and programs that affect our partners
  • Assist with events and promotions as needed (occasionally off-site, potentially during hours outside of regular service)

    • WHEN & WHERE YOU’LL DO IT
    • Up to 5 days per week, 38 hours a week (schedule may change based on business needs; we need someone who’s flexible)

    • You have retail and/or customer experience

    • You are a tech savvy

The Commercial Direct team is a division of FlexiGroup, working with small, medium and large businesses, government bodies and educational institutions to provide tailored, flexible, tax effective and cash-flow efficient ways to access the latest business technology and equipment.

The Commercial Direct business and this role is suited to someone who is driven, passionate, pro-active and able to multi-task, with a wide range of experience within sales environments.

FlexiGroup operates with a relatively flat organisational structure and all team members are required to take endto-end responsibility for their area of focus. They must also be flexible and able to take on additional and/or different portfolios as required.

\xa0

About the Role

The purpose of this role is to manage a portfolio of existing sellers and their buyers to increase revenue growth\xa0and profitability. This growth is achieved by effective management of the portfolio sales pipeline, activity levels\xa0and sales ratios. Internal account managers need to develop a strong business relationship with internal and\xa0external stakeholders and operate as the single point of contact for all of the commercial sellers within their\xa0portfolio.

About Mission Australia Early Learning

Early childhood is a time of discovery and growth, which is why Mission Australia Early Learning centres are designed to encourage a sense of belonging, wellbeing and community. Our centres offer much more than quality childcare for children aged from six weeks to six years. They also set children up for a lifelong love of learning and nature.

Mission Australia is a Christian community service organisation with a nationwide team of over 2,900 that helps people to regain their independence.

We reduce homelessness and strengthen communities through homelessness initiatives and affordable housing, early learning and youth services, family support, and employment and skills development.

Together, we stand with Australians in need until they can stand for themselves.

About The Role

We have an exciting new opportunity for a Certificate 3 qualified Childcare Worker to join the team at our Keilor Village Child Care Centre on a casual basis. In this role, you will work as part of a team to provide quality early education and care for children whilst also providing holistic care for children and their families.

Duties
  • Child Support – actively engage and develop a nurturing environment for all children
  • Family Support - build strong relationships with parents to ensure open communication
  • Program Support – contribute to play based learning and education program for children
  • Team Support – pro-actively participate in all activities and communications with wider team
  • Child Protection – identify, respond and document any child protection risks as required


Qualifications & Experience
  • Proven experience in a similar role in a child care centre
  • Flexibility to work varied hours between Monday - Friday
  • Certificate 3 Qualified in Children's Services
  • Current First Aid Certificate
  • Current Working with Children Check
  • Demonstrated ability to remain vigilant in ensuring the care of all children is maintained
  • Commitment to ensuring centre is compliant as per Health, Safety and Welfare requirements
  • A genuine passion and drive in providing children with the best possible start in life
  • A strong alignment to Mission Australia's purpose and values

As part of our employment screening process you will be required to undertake a national criminal history check. In addition, there is a requirement to possess a current Working with Children Check or apply if you do not already hold one.

Benefits
  • 25 % casual loading over pay rate.
  • Above Award rates
  • Opportunities for career advancement
  • Ongoing support for training and professional development

Diversity & Inclusion

Mission Australia is an inclusive employer. We celebrate our diversity and strive to reflect contemporary Australian society and all the communities in which we work, in order to better serve our clients. We welcome and encourage applications from Women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, Culturally and Linguistically Diverse people, People with Disability, Sexually and Gender Diverse people, people with lived experience of adversity and from people of all ages.

Click "APPLY NOW" attaching resume and cover letter.

For further information regarding working with us visit please visit our website at missionaustralia.com.au/careers or contact Kath Power, Talent Attraction Business Partner on 07 3394 8193 [link removed] [link removed].

Mission Australia is dedicated to increasing opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Australians. Learn about our Reconciliation Action Plan on our website at missionaustralia.com.au/what-we-do/policy-development-advocacy/reconciliation-action-plan.

Seniority Level

Entry level

  • Nonprofit Organization Management
  • Government Administration
  • Hospital & Health Care

  • Information Technology

886435521:
[

National Head of Cyber Security

Company Name RiskLogic Company Location Level 7 74 Castlereagh St, Sydney, NSW 2000, AU

New Posted Date Posted 5 hours ago Number of views 12 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Our vision is to work with inspired people to build meaningful organisations that contribute to a better tomorrow. At RiskLogic we do this every day by empowering people to successfully navigate the worst of situations like cyber-attacks, terrorism, physical disasters, health epidemics to name a few. With the right tools, training and experience we help people safeguard what’s important to them to build a more Resilient Future.

\xa0

The RiskLogic Group consists of market leading Consulting Services (RiskLogic), Emergency Response Training (FirstAction) and Technology Solutions (Catalyst) that assist corporate, not‑for‑profit and government clients throughout Australia and New Zealand.

\xa0

The National\xa0Head of Cyber Security\xa0is a newly created position that will be responsible for developing a market-leading cyber security consulting service to complement and supplement RiskLoigic’s existing consulting services.

\xa0

In this role, you will play a key role in developing RiskLogic’s new Cyber Security consulting strategy that leverages off RiskLogic’s existing cyber consulting capabilities including strategy development, response procedures, and the training and exercising of response teams. You will facilitate the set-up of all operational requirements for the newly created Cyber security function as well as providing effective and positive leadership.

\xa0

You are a passionate Cyber Security Expert who can promote a culture of cohesive and responsive service to clients through effective leadership and a solid track record of delivering relevant services to clients via best practice advice. You must be in a position to travel to our clients across Australia and overseas and build and maintain strong client relationships as well as set the strategic direction and vision for the new Cyber Security function.

\xa0

Key Responsibilities:

\xa0

  • Facilitating the development of cyber security processes, procedures, tools and templates to support the new service offering.
  • Leading sales and marketing efforts to create awareness of the new offering within the existing RiskLogic client base and to the broader market.
  • Delivering cyber security consulting services to existing clients.
  • Manage the financial performance of the Cyber Security Function and report to key stakeholders
  • Oversee and the daily operations of the Cyber Security Function and collaborate with Regional Teams and other divisions to provide integrated client outcomes across crisis management, incident management and business continuity
  • Support the company’s growth targets by securing new business development opportunities for cyber security related services
  • Establish a position of influence and contribute to ongoing quality management and continuous improvement of innovative cyber security strategies

\xa0

Skills/Experience

\xa0

  • Minimum 10 years’ experience in delivering relevant cyber security services ideally within a consulting firm
  • Minimum 10 years’ experience working in an IT services, disaster recovery and/or cyber security environment
  • Minimum 10 years’ experience facilitating training sessions and exercises
  • Exceptional, project management and organisational skills and ability to problem solve and influence project outcomes
  • A performance driven mindset and strong commercial acumen and create and maintain solid relationships at all levels
  • The ability to adapt to diverse environments, manage multiple priorities and drive for continuous improvement and delivery of quality outcomes

\xa0

\xa0

Work with us!
We’re a team of diverse and passionate enthusiasts. Everyone is empowered by exploring and implementing innovative ideas and improvements. We’re growing, which means lots of opportunities and we make these opportunities real by helping you get there. We thrive and collaborate in an open activity-based workspace, utilise the latest technologies and provide a great culture for you to thrive in. As an integral member of the RiskLogic team, you’ll model our core values with your words and actions: People.\xa0Integrity. Passion. Innovation. Performance.

\xa0

Interested?

If you have the skills and experience required for this role, we look forward to receiving your cover letter and resume. For further information, please email Teresa Vitale, Talent Acquisition Manager at careers@risklogic.com.au.

\xa0

\xa0

\xa0


\xa0
